definition: surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

sentences.english: They never defend anyone or anything if they can help it;
sentences.chinese: 如果能夠避免，他們從不衛護任何人或任何事。

sentences.english: Reason, your viceroy in me, me should defend.
sentences.chinese: 統領我的理智，本當將我衛護。

sentences.english: The only thing he necessarily stands by is the razor .
sentences.chinese: 他唯一需要衛護的是他的剃刀。

sentences.english: The press is a guardian of the public weal.
sentences.chinese: 報刊是公共福利的衛護者。

sentences.english: "The Lord bless thee and keep thee"?
The Four Heavenly Kings and their relatives will protect him day and night.
sentences.chinese: 四大天王與諸眷屬晝夜衛護。

sentences.english: Dan shall judge his people like another tribe in Israel.
sentences.chinese: 丹將如以色列的一個支派，衛護自己的人民。

definition: to assist a ruler in governing a country/prime minister
to start a rebellion/to rise in revolt
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to draw government pay/to be in public service/salary of an official
to prevent or treat a disease
variant of 輾轉|辗转[zhan3 zhuan3]
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
